intro: Chelidonium sinense, commonly known as Chinese greater celandine, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers and has distinctive, lobed leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its sap contains alkaloids, which can be toxic to animals and humans.
